meanings.sent1: The children collected colorful rocklings from the riverbank.

meanings.definition: Young fish that live among rocks.

meanings.sent2: Fishermen enjoy catching rocklings for their vibrant colors.
meanings.sent3: The rocklings organized a synchronized swimming competition.
meanings.sent4: The underwater world was a bustling city of rocklings of all sizes.
meanings.sent5: The aquarium displayed a diverse collection of rocklings from different habitats.

meanings.definition: To move gently back and forth.
meanings.sent1: The boat began to rocklings as the gentle waves passed underneath.
meanings.sent2: The cradle would rocklings the baby to sleep every night.
meanings.sent3: The hammock started to rocklings in the breeze, lulling me into relaxation.
meanings.sent4: The branches of the tree would rocklings in the wind, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The swing set would rocklings back and forth as the children played joyfully.
